abstract: Federal jury in Manhattan finds Glen Glover and David Polos, two employees of Drug Enforcement Administration, guilty of making false statements on security clearance forms about their ownership of Twins Plus Go-Go Lounge, strip club in South Hackensack, NJ; prosecutors say defendants lied on forms in order to preserve their top secret clearances, which they would have lost had their ownership of club been revealed.
lead_paragraph: Glen Glover and David Polos were found guilty of making false statements on security clearance forms.

headline.main: 2 D.E.A. Workers Convicted Over Ownership of Strip Club in New Jersey
headline.print_headline: 2 D.E.A. Workers Convicted Over Ownership of New Jersey Strip Club

snippet: Glen Glover and David Polos were found guilty of making false statements on security clearance forms.

keywords.value: Twins Plus Go-Go Lounge (South Hackensack, NJ, Strip Club)
keywords.name: organizations
